33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:44): okay, guys, WTF
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:44): why does executeSql work async?
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:44): is the fact the transaction callback is run asynchronously already not enough?
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:45): I'm surprised that ResultSets can be accessed without involving callbacks somewhere
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:55): 33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20: anything that might take more than zero time is async, otherwise the browser might lock up while the call is happening
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: then to be honest rows.length should also be async, as as the spec notes it might be expensive
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:56): besides, there are already *Sync() variants, so the lockup is still possible
e1b6d0b431cf5281f54819dfc2735b42 (23:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, did you get back to anyone on that missing PUT/DELETE thing?
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:57): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: and unrelated to async, I still think that the whole changeVersion() interface is horribly broken
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:57): why does it not pass in the current DB version?
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:57): you have no way to enumerate DBs, and no way to learn the current version
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (23:58): so you have to try each possible combination of versions until one works

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:00): 33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20: yeah, the .rows being sync and the changeVersion() API sucking are known bugs. That spec is dead though so I doubt anything will happen to fix those problems.

33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (00:03): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: so we have WebSQL, which is a huge pain to use, and broken in many places, and will never be supported by Mozilla, and IndexedDB, which is similarly broken but doesn't give a useful query language
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:03): For the broken parts, comment on it!
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (00:03): proposed specs should not have glaring bugs apparent on the first reading ever :(
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:03): it = IndexedDB.
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (00:03): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: the draft at W3C doesn't have a nice comment box like the whatwg documents do
33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (00:03): but in a nutshell, it's race conditions waiting to happen
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:04): No, but it has a mailing list.

33ad25ed5e7950dce85e69b1a4fa8a20 (00:04): "Every method for making asynchronous requests returns an IDBRequest object that communicates back to the requesting application through events." <-- here be race conditions
